pull.title: Do not link `bench` and `ctime_tests` to `COMMON_LIB`
pull.body: The `bench` and `ctime_tests` binaries are users of the library, they should only be linked to the library, not the objects it was built from.

repo.name: secp256k1
repo.description: Optimized C library for EC operations on curve secp256k1

repo.name: secp256k1
repo.description: Optimized C library for EC operations on curve secp256k1

verification.payload:
tree be0a403a86ef35900009fe80514d7f8a797b8da4
parent e1817a6f54faa20bc7f40d5a9a98a815bd6b6f57
author Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1675118559 +0000
committer Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1675118559 +0000

Do not link `bench` and `ctime_tests` to `COMMON_LIB`

The `bench` and `ctime_tests` are users of the library, they should only
be linked to the library, not the objects it was built from.

events.message:
Do not link `bench` and `ctime_tests` to `COMMON_LIB`

The `bench` and `ctime_tests` are users of the library, they should only
be linked to the library, not the objects it was built from.

issue.title: build: Add CMake-based build system
issue.body:
This PR adds a [CMake](https://cmake.org/)-based build system.

Added build instructions and examples to the [`README.md`](https://github.com/hebasto/secp256k1/blob/220628-cmake/README.md#building-with-cmake-experimental) file.

Ways to integrate with downstream CMake-based projects:
- if `secp256k1` is a subtree (including Bitcoin Core project) -- `add_subdirectory(secp256k1)`
- if `secp256k1` has been installed -- `find_package(secp256k1 0.2.1 CONFIG)`, see https://github.com/hebasto/secp256k1-CMake-example

Added a few toolchain files for easy cross compiling.

Discussions on IRC:
- https://gnusha.org/secp256k1/2022-06-23.log
- https://gnusha.org/secp256k1/2022-06-24.log
- https://gnusha.org/secp256k1/2022-06-27.log
- https://gnusha.org/secp256k1/2023-01-30.log

---

Related PRs:
- #315 
- #549 
- #761 

---

**Implementation notes**

Minimum required CMake version is 3.1. This was required to provide [`C_STANDARD`](https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/prop_tgt/C_STANDARD.html) property.

In turn, this choice of CMake version implies it is not possible to build with default CMake on Debian 8, which has CMake v3.0.2 only.

Also see:
- [CMake Versions on Linux Distros](https://gitlab.kitware.com/cmake/community/-/wikis/CMake-Versions-on-Linux-Distros)
- https://repology.org/project/cmake/versions

---

# Autotools -- CMake Feature Parity Tables

## 1. Configuration options

Autotool-based build system features being listed according to the `./configure --help` output. 

| Autotools | CMake |
|---|---|
| `--prefix` | `-DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX` 
| `--enable-shared` | `-DSECP256K1_BUILD_SHARED` |
| `--enable-static` | `-DSECP256K1_BUILD_STATIC` |
| `--enable-dev-mode` _hidden_ | N/A, see https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/pull/1113#discussion_r916979117 |
| `--enable-benchmark` | `-DSECP256K1_BUILD_BENCHMARK` |
| `--enable-coverage` | `-DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Coverage` |
| `--enable-tests` | `-DSECP256K1_BUILD_TESTS` |
| `--enable-ctime-tests` | `-DSECP256K1_BUILD_CTIME_TESTS` |
| `--enable-experimental` | `-DSECP256K1_EXPERIMENTAL` |
| `--enable-exhaustive-tests` | `-DSECP256K1_BUILD_EXHAUSTIVE_TESTS` |
| `--enable-examples` | `-DSECP256K1_BUILD_EXAMPLES` |
| `--enable-module-ecdh` | `-DSECP256K1_ENABLE_MODULE_ECDH` |
| `--enable-module-recovery` | `-DSECP256K1_ENABLE_MODULE_RECOVERY` |
| `--enable-module-extrakeys` | `-DSECP256K1_ENABLE_MODULE_EXTRAKEYS` |
| `--enable-module-schnorrsig` | `-DSECP256K1_ENABLE_MODULE_SCHNORRSIG` |
| `--enable-external-default-callbacks` | `-DSECP256K1_USE_EXTERNAL_DEFAULT_CALLBACKS` |
| `--with-test-override-wide-multiply` _hidden_ | `-DSECP256K1_TEST_OVERRIDE_WIDE_MULTIPLY` |
| `--with-asm` | `-DSECP256K1_ASM` |
| `--with-ecmult-window` | `-DSECP256K1_ECMULT_WINDOW_SIZE` |
| `--with-ecmult-gen-precision` | `-DSECP256K1_ECMULT_GEN_PREC_BITS` |
| `--with-valgrind` | `-DSECP256K1_VALGRING` |

A screenshot of grouped options from `cmake-gui`:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32963518/214821305-fc3ffe82-4d05-4dd7-b2c2-7ca2d5d12e86.png)

## 2. `make` targets

| Autotools | CMake |
|---|---|
| `make` | `make` |
| `make check` | `make check` |
| `make install` | `make install` * |

* Installation of `lib/pkgconfig/libsecp256k1.pc` not implemented.

issue.title: Upstream PRs 1160, 1193, 1169, 1190, 1192, 1194, 1196, 1195, 1170, 1172, 1200, 1199, 1203, 1201, 1206, 1078, 1209, 979, 1212, 1218, 1217, 1221, 1222
issue.body:
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1160]: Makefile: add `-I$(top_srcdir)/{include,src}` to `CPPFLAGS` for precomputed
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1193]: Add `noverify_tests` to `.gitignore`
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1169]: Add support for msan instead of valgrind (for memcheck and ctime test)
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1190]: Make all non-API functions (except main) static
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1192]: Switch to exhaustive groups with small B coefficient
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1194]: Ensure safety of ctz_debruijn implementation.
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1196]: Drop no longer used variables from the build system
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1195]: ctime_tests: improve output when CHECKMEM_RUNNING is not defined
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1170]: contexts: Forbid destroying, cloning and randomizing the static context
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1172]: benchmarks: fix bench_scalar_split
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1200]: Drop no longer used Autoheader macros
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1199]: ci: Minor improvements inspired by Bitcoin Core
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1203]: Do not link `bench` and `ctime_tests` to `COMMON_LIB`
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1201]: ci: Do not set git's `user.{email,name}` config options
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1206]: build: Add -Wreserved-identifier supported by clang
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1078]: group: Save a normalize_to_zero in gej_add_ge
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1209]: build: Add SECP256K1_API_VAR to fix importing variables from DLLs
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#979]: Native jacobi symbol algorithm
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1212]: Prevent dead-store elimination when clearing secrets in examples
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1218]: Update overflow check
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1217]: Add secp256k1_fe_add_int function
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1221]: Update Changelog
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1222]: Remove redundant checks.

- made -zkp functions static where possible
- CTIMETEST -> CTIMETESTS
- VG_CHECK_VERIFY(r->n, sizeof(r->n)); -> SECP256K1_CHECKMEM_CHECK_VERIFY

The next PR introduces cmake.
